pullRequest.title: Group deposits together by block
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description
Ensures that all deposits in a single block and processed together when creating the genesis state as required by the spec.
Normally we publish a block when we start receiving deposits from the next block, but to ensure the last deposit on the chain is published we also consider a block complete if 5 seconds passes without receiving a deposit.  This isn't ideal as it's possible something just caused a delay in sending new deposits but keeps things running for now.  We will need to follow up to request all deposits from the block that timed out (https://pegasys1.atlassian.net/browse/BC-248) to solve this.
Builds on #1119

nodes.bodyText: (optional) Might be safer to move this line into publishPendingBlock
Doesn't look like we're handling reorgs where events might be removed, but I guess that's covered in the follow-up ticket we have to respect the follow distance?
